intro: Strychnos heterodoxa, commonly known as the African poisonwood, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces small, red berries that contain toxic seeds, which are used in traditional medicine despite their harmful properties. Its roots and leaves contain alkaloids, including strychnine, which are highly poisonous and have been historically used in various medicinal and toxicological contexts.
